title: One of my Favs... BUT!
text:
I’ve used Google since I’ve owned a phone and currently that’s an iPhone. I love the news feed and that I can make it my own. What I don’t like now is why can’t I swipe off the cards I’ve read? This was so convenient. Please bring back this feature!
Also, where are my Google weather, sports, entertainment eat and drink shortcuts? I like being able to click the weather and see the frog or look restaurants etc with just a touch of the button! Someone please check this stuff out!

title: Enjoy the app but....
text:
Great relevant info I enjoy reading. Finds articles I wouldn’t have otherwise have found on my own. However, whoever thought that removing swipe to dismiss gesture was a good idea is sadly mistaken. This needs to be added back if intentional, or fix the bug!

UPDATE 7.21 - they removed the for you section which shows relevant info for commuting, weather, info from emails and migrated that to the google assistant. This makes this app pretty close to useless. Google has a bad habit of breaking up apps, creating new ones, creating multiple apps that overlap in use, etc. it’s just bad app development and should be addressed.

title: Good search engine, bad recommendations
text: Great search engine as you’d expect, but outside of the search bar, the recommendation engine for news / tiles is really poor. Where’s the AI? Repeats dismissed articles (straight-up) and repeats same articles under different topics. Topics adequately describe the articles they’re filed under, and they’re often irrelevant topics anyways. The things I want to read about don’t show up consistently, and the app needs a better tool to tell the engine that I don’t want to see something. “Dismiss” doesn’t achieve it. Getting to the point where I’ll just use the chrome app and get my news and updates elsewhere.

title: FIX THIS GLITCH PLEASE
text:
I’m not sure when it started happening, but recently whenever I try to open this app through iMessage (I use iMessage since I don’t hav screen time on actual google) it sends me to the actual app, not the iMessage version. Please fix this! Other I than this one specific issue the entire app works brilliantly!

P.S. if you have had issue too, write a review! The more people that write about this, the more awareness the company has over the issue, thanks I’m advance!

title: Awesome app! I have a request
text:
So like I said it is a great app. Read other reviews if you want to know how good it is. 

Request: For the keyboard I wanted to request for two finger swipe support. There is an app called Nintype that does this but it isn't very stable. I love the using two fingers to type and I'm sure many other people out there do also. Using both of them to swipe at the same time is amazing. I figured if someone could accomplish this taksk if would be Google.

title: Account issues
text:
I have switched into a new phone and have forgotten my passwords to my accounts, and when I try to use my phone number it says “Phone number used too many times” I suggest google to allow us to use our phone numbers an unlimited amount of times. So next to tried to make a new account, but after I click “next” after writing my name it says “Error account not made” I have been re-trying many times but it won’t work. Please allow me to create an account without it asking for my phone number because as I’ve said before it’s been used too many times
please and thank you,

title: App is Fustrating
text: Google app was so easy to navigate. Now I can’t do anything without being confused. If I Accidentally click on a redirect link I won’t be able to tab out easily, using SEARCH BAR( was replaced with copy link which is something I hate the most), and I can’t use that < arrow thing to go back to last site which was removed and replaced with an X sign Also THE DAM SAVE IMAGE THING WAS REMOVED was removed, and HALF OF WHY I USE GOOGLE IS REMOVED. I’d rather use safari or edge FOR now than this app. It’s just frustrating to use since this “ new features to provide a better search experience. “ update

title: Strong arming users is a bad choice
text: EVERY SINGLE TIME I try to use your search engine in Safari you force a pop up ad for the Google search mobile app. I understand you and Apple are fighting over privacy handling, but this recent tactic has simply alienated someone who previously really liked using your search engine. Off to Duck Duck Go, I go. They’re not as good now, but they’re getting better and way faster than having to close a pop up ad EVERY SINGLE SEARCH. I hate even looking at your logo now. I think you abandoned the don’t be evil, but you should try not to be super annoying to the user base if you want that user base to hang around.

title: The new “just for you” feature is terrible
text: Get rid of the “just for you” feature where the Home Screen search button used to be, why would you change it?! I don’t need you to tell me what I might want to see, I know what I want to see and search for because I’M OPENING GOOGLE TO SEARCH FOR IT. It’s so incredibly annoying when I’m like “I wonder when this movie came out, let me Google it real quick” and I open the Google app and there’s no automatic way to get to the search bar anymore until you force close the app because now it’s a “just for you” link??? The search button should be the main feature... ISN’T THAT THE POINT OF GOOGLE?!

title: Crashes Constantly
text: I’ve been using this app for years, and it’s fantastic. I love saving searches, have a history of what I looked up, etc. For the past two months or so it works maybe once every ten times. When you type something in and hit “search,” the progress bar doesn’t even attempt to load. It freezes. None of the buttons work. If you switch to another app and then back to Google, it still doesn’t work and will force-close itself after a few seconds. It is incredibly frustrating and I’m close to deleting it entirely. (iOS 14 with the most updated version)

title: It's perfect but one thing
text: For some reason when I "surf" the web, it doesn't load all the webpages and it kinda leaves it's white background where pages should be. You can't even click on the webpages that are shown, it's completely froze. But you can press the Google logo on the left of the search bar and it takes you back to the main page then press the bottom right symbol and it's like you never left ( may have waisted some time but feels like you never left )

title: Hello yes
text: So I saw that another person had this problem I wish for you to check this out. As the other person, when ever I run of of screen time, I go on to the google option on on the texting app to do stuff that I couldn’t with out screen time. However, in a recent update it now wants to bring me to the actual google app. If you guys could fix that I’d be AWSOME. Other than that, probably one of my most used apps. I love google.

title: iPhone Maps
text: Google App it’s cool! But it doesn’t want to work with my iPhone Maps App!  when I click on directions instead of asking me or going to Maps (iPhone Maps not Google Maps) it goes to Safari! And then it asks me if I want to download the Google maps app which I don’t want to do! I prefer the Maps that comes with the iPhone! Please fix! It’s been a while and it’s annoying to copy and paste the directions! Thanks for reading! I already uninstalled and reinstalled the app I already updated the app and it still not working! So please fix the issue!

title: Love hate relationship
text: I’ve always loved the google app but lately when you search for something “near me” you can’t click on the places, it always leads me to a blank screen. Same thing happens if I click “more places” it’s super frustrating and I’m going to have to find another app to use now because it defeats the purpose of me having the app if I can’t search for things near me. Also when I use to click directions it use to automatically open up in my maps app, not anymore. That’s why I have to give the app 3 stars. PLEASE fix these issues

title: Frustrating
text:
I generally really like the app, it gives me great results and has been giving me interesting news stories. I also love the collections feature. 

However, I am extremely frustrated by how slowly pages load. I will click on a recipe or article and it takes a good minute for it to fully load, and when I scroll around it has to reload. I always open the page in safari because I know I will actually be able to use the page in a reasonable time. It’s so frustrating it makes me not want to use the app at all.

title: I Use Google For everything!
text: It's GOOGLE! It doesn't matter where you are, who you are with, or what you are doing, GOOGLE just makes it better, more interesting, and easier. Although, lately we play a game. When we are trying to recall an event, a place, a person, we wait, for ten minutes, to see if we get it, with out the invaluable assistance from GOOGLE. Thank you to all of the visionaries who provide this tool, this experience, this miracle.

title: It's Convenient for two Step login and GBoard!
text: The app is a nice bundle of useful tools. One request I'd like to see is the ability to delete individual guessed words. For example if I use swipe keyboard to type 'yes' it will now only go to 'yessssss' instead. There isn't a way to delete individual words that are being selected otherwise I'd have to reset the keyboard back to basic settings. It would be cool if we can see the word and if it's not a word we want to be guessed we can hold and choose to have it not come up.

title: It OK
text: Its ok but sometimes when i try to google stuff it takes a while to find what i am looking for. Also its also auto corrects if i spell something wrong or missed a letter which i like but sometimes i get annoyed by it. But i can only use this google because all the other googles like google crom or wut ever its called its not like this google its like you can fast forward it or else it changed to a different video so this is like the only google i can go on.

title: “Want to find a song?”
text:
“Just hum part of the song & google will identify it for you” 

Now THAT seems quite fascinating of a concept to be honest… 🤔 

I wanted to take a whack at it myself… 
(Not that those moments ever arise now days, I’ve certainly already gone about discovering exactly what tune is which n what album it’s off of & yada yada at this point in my life….) 

But… where ‘is’ this so called feature?? 

I tap the little advertisement about it … all it does is opens an app store link … to take me to the Google app … to install Google app that I obviously already have… 

How do I try out this 
“Human- based” Shazzam feature that YOU become the source of identifying the specific name of a song …? 

I want to see how strong 💪🏻 my humming or whistling game is :p lol

title: Google literally gives you false information
text: Hi, my name is Emma and I have been using Google for a long time now. I am also a middle school student and I will use Google to look up information for a study guide or something. When I was doing a school project for a book, I failed the test because Google gave me the wrong answers. Also I know this is irrelevant, but Google literally says that Kyle and Cartman from South Park are dating.  LIKE WHAT💀💀💀 and Google also said that Kenny, McCormick is secretly rich and he is being poor for attention💀💀💀 if you don’t believe me look up “is Kenny McCormick poor Southpark”

title: Perfect to pointless
text: I use to love the Google app as my primary search engine on my phone. It was simple, very easily customizable, looked sleek, overall I loved it as a phone browser. Recently it has had a very simple issue that ultimately ruins the app. You can’t save a photo. It props you to search in the image (google lens) or to search for the image however there is no way to save a photo unless you screenshot or find the image source. Simple problem with huge consequences. It’s been a while and it hasn’t been fixed yet so I am likely to use a different app instead.

title: Ed Cline Appraisals 5 STARS
text: My husband and I can’t say enough great things about Ed Cline Appraisals! Dan went above and beyond in delivering stellar customer service. This escrow threw us a few curve balls and our timeline was under crunch time. Dan made it happen despite the inconvenience and we were able to close. Thank you again for the professionalism and A+ customer service! We’ll definitely be using them for every rental property from here on out!

title: The app keeps crashing!
text:
I can’t use the app at all as it won’t even open! The screen flashes briefly and then goes back to the Home Screen. I have tried powering my phone off, uninstalling and reinstalling the app and everything else that anyone has suggested. This started out of the blue this afternoon. Please help!!!

Update:
Google responded and fixed the problem!!! 
I am now giving them 5 stars😁

title: Discover not Available
text:
Pretty much if I open the app and this message pops up, I know the app is going to useless for at least the next hour. I don’t know what is messed up but it only does this at the most inconvenient times, when I’m in an argument or a rush. Then the app doesn’t seem to want to work. I can’t search or anything. My network is fine and I will be next to someone that can search on the same internet connection I am and it still won’t work. It’s very frustrating and annoying.

It should also be illegal the fact that I cannot sign my information out of any of these apps easily.

title: Good but needs some work.
text: This app is pretty good, the menus are nice, and it’s easy to use. However it has some problems. First and most importantly, you can’t set it to your default browser. Meaning every time I click a link, it opens safari, which is annoying. Also the number of tabs shown in the box is never correct for some reason. Lastly, why is this the only way to get Google lens on mobile? Chrome is much better.

title: Feature Loss
text:
Sadly, one can no longer search on or navigate to a GPS coordinate. That means that one can no longer find a destination’s GPS  coordinates with Google Earth and then navigate to that coordinate location using Google Maps or usefully share that coordinate location with other Google Maps users.  There are now many locations that Google Maps cannot find: trail head parking areas, locations on many country roads, etc. Fortunately, my car’s navigation system will navigate to a GPS coordinate location.

My use of Google Maps has plummeted.

title: Yay! It works again!
text: I was so mad after the last IOS update, that suddenly my google app would continuously crash after about 30 seconds. I even ran the last Google update & was so disappointed that it didn’t fix the issue. I didn’t realize just how much I used this app until I couldn’t and had to pull Google up in safari each time. Much more frustrating. Happy to have this working again. Thanks!

title: I wish I could remove the recommended feed from the front page
text:
This app works well, but I’m constantly being shown stupid blog posts behind paywalls and fan-created content for an old video game I looked up a few times. Filtering things out feels futile because more stuff fills the feed. I buy a French press, and then all I see are shallow opinion pieces on why they make the best tasting coffee that are basically more ads for French presses. I’m not in the market anymore.

This section takes up the whole front page of the app, and it isn’t serving me.

title: Latest update has a horrible transition to maps
text: When I search for a business near me and then click on directions to that place, it no longer automatically takes me to the Google Maps App. Instead it asks me if I want to open maps in my browser or if I want to open Google Maps. Not only is this a cumbersome extra step, but if you select to go to the App, instead of simply showing you the route from your current location, it defaults immediately to voice directions. I don’t want voice directions. I want to see the route (i.e. where is it, how far is it, how heavy is traffic, etc). Please go back to the prior version!!!

title: Not A News Feed
text: I downloaded this app for a news feed because it seemed to be intuitive, allowing your searches to show news I’d be interested in. Instead, this app can show you 20 stories a day before you run into sites which show the same story you read a few minutes ago. When you hide specific categories, you’ll still see them with the only option to hide the site instead. Most subjects also continue to show up with the option to hide, but still continually appear even when hiding it. Overall there is no point in downloading if you want to search. Just use a browser and search instead.

title: Drains battery and cannot swipe to dismiss
text:
I used to love using the Google app, and would open it multiple times in a day to check my feed, weather and sports scores. However, with the latest version Google has taken away my ability to dismiss cards with a simple swipe, which means idea bunch of cards I don't care about in my feed constantly. 

The latest version of the app has also been draining my iPhones battery, with 8min of reading resulting in Google showing up as consuming 55% of my battery in a day. In comparison, Reddit used 8% of my battery after 36 min of reading. This is simply unacceptable.

title: Bring Back Close All Tabs
text: The app keeps the pages you don't go out of your way to close, so naturally you'll stack up open tabs from just doing quick searches. Google ruined the app by changing the open tabs layout, forcing users to close each single tab individually compared to their old close all button. This wouldn't be too big of a problem but the layout is slower with a noticeable delay in closing out a tab and moving to a new one compared to the instant swipe to close method from past versions. This might have been a slight oversight, but it really is a step backwards for google as far as functionality at the cost of the user.

title: Title
text:
Old: It used to work, although not perfectly, it does work, but now for some reason every time I open the app, it crashes after 1 minute or 2, it doesn’t matter what I do in app, either searching up stuff or remain idle, the app crashes, restarting the phone did not work and deleting and reinstalling did not work, I hope to this will be fixed soon

The new update or time fixed it, idk what the reply is even replying to

title: Search a Song ( is gone )
text: On IOS / Apple Phone.    The SEARCH A SONG option has been Removed from Google App.  I don’t know why it was removed because it worked very well in the past.   I hope it is re-added in the future.   I tried everything from reinstalling it to clearing Cache thinking it was a me problem.   When you ask Google to search a song using the MIC icon 🎤, it does not give you a prompt to hum.   it just immediately put something in a search bar to hum a song.

title: Google is unsafe. Mountain View location is a No !
text: Google allows apos to be downloaded on multiple devices and the ability to block you from seeing all devices it's downloaded onto. 75 apps downloaded onto google play & I did not download google play on Ios device. it's as if apps are being mirrored and your only getting access to digital apps websites controlled by others. not direct network access to the companies in which you are dealing with. guessing I have to get a esim, to make sure i have direct access ! If others want to keep you guessing my mom always instilled in me, treat others how they treat you !!!!!💜

title: Pop Ups Are Terrible
text:
The pop ups that read ‘congratulations you’ve won this or that’ is absolutely terrible because you can’t read articles fully or search for anything without them popping up. There has to be a way to fix this because they didn’t start popping up until recently and until it’s fixed the app is useless!

Update: Nothing has changed I still get pop ups congratulating me for winning an iPhone, iPad, or gift cards to different stores. I don’t know why they haven’t fixed this issue because they pop up so much you can’t hardly do anything. Please fix this issue!!!

title: Doesn’t work with safety tracking on screen time iOS
text: I use screen time to manage my kids access. Unfortunately, third party apps can leave parents out of luck. You can’t track sites nor limit site access when third party browsers are used. A huge improvement would allow greater rule-management from the screen time function. I don’t want to prevent app downloads, or I will be downloading games for days. Instead, allowing expanded data access (i.e: tracking sites, preventing incognito, limiting site access) from apple would support parents in ensuring their children are navigating the web safely. Huge ding!!

title: Needs Work still?
text:
Everything works fine, if you’re searching just for the Big Box stores and those independent business owners that can afford to pay 💰 to be placed first on any search 🔦 for the region. 

Then as soon as you cross south of the boarder. Everything you are searching for becomes even more prevalent. That only USA chains are accurate, but not many of the local business searches and mappings are not! Which will get you lost and send you to the wrong addresses and places. 😒

title: Glitchy app. You would think a GOOGLE APP would be top of the line...
text: Won’t allow me to view a critical security alert because it asks you to confirm your identity every time you would like to view your activity. Then after you confirm it brings you back to the check activity tab.(have changed browser, app, and even device) It’s an endless circle and a waste of time. At least it let me change my password. Surprisingly. It’s things like this that made me go from yahoo to google years ago. Now I’m ready to just use my iCloud since the whole reason I liked google was connivence but it’s become too much.

title: Pls fix
text: So I updated it. And there used to be a back button on the upper-left back to the search results page. But now with the new update it's just back to a previous page, which takes away all purpose of Google and just makes it a re-skin of Chrome. Pls fix this since I found it rlly helpful to go all the way back to the searched results page when Ive gone down many links instead of clicking a million times to go back to the search results page.

title: Awful!!!
text: So Google has made its CEO a billionaire.    Good for you.  So now, how about hiring a few HUMANS to address some of your big issues!!    I cannot use Google for any 2 step verification purposes!   It seems to know my email address just fine, until I have to verify something.   Then it lists the WRONG 3rd letters for my account!   I cannot see the rest of the address.   And there is no way to fix this.   No human being works at Google  to help with this.   Google has no accountability, and has been given frightening advantages by our sleepy Congress .   I truly despise this company.    I hope for some competition to come along to put you out of business.   It is what Google deserves.

title: This app is great, except for one small issue
text:
I like this app because its convenient to open and have google at my finger and the news articles it bring up. 

The only issue is when I open the app it has articles already loaded and I often see one that catches my eye but the app reloads the page and it’s replaced with other stuff and that’s annoying. It used to not do that and say “new stuff is available, reload to see it” but that’s gone and it’s really annoying.

title: No warning
text:
No warning how easy it is to access pornographic material,
 porn videos   live  “Cam 2 Cam” videos etc. 
As a parent it’s very disheartening knowing after going through this app on my sons iPad who just/ he turned 13 years old how much porn he has been looking at it does say ages 17 and up but it should say at least 21 and up.
I tried to teach my kids their whole life’s., raising them how bad porn corrupts the mind and will affect them and their future relationships.  Now due too  the easy access through this app every kid in America is typing in this four letter word that’s corrupting our children thanks to Google

title: Can't update your app
text:
??Impossible to download, because of iTunes glitch that Apple is not fixing

Dear developer, it's impossible for us to download your app or buy new ones from iTunes Enterprise MAC that is used both by businesses, schools and individuals who can't afford to download the same app several times for each device.

Please let Apple know about this issue. For the time being till the issue is going to be resolved, we will not be able to update your apps. Thanks for your support!

title: Was crashing after update 111.0
text: This app is my favorite web browsing/search engine app. Just wanted to say that after update 111.0 it started crashing every time I ran the app, usually within about 30 seconds of run time. Simple solution seems to be uninstall and then reinstall the app. Haven’t had any crashes since. Hope this helps some people who are experiencing app instability after the latest update rolled out.

title: Never heard of “if it’s not broke don’t fix it”
text: Please don’t ever offload your app because you’ll never seems like anyways be able to download google earth app on your phone ever again. Anyone and everyone that works for Google (I know they like to tell themselves they’re smart) they are absolute imbeciles!!!!!!! Don’t bother trying to be nice the first 15 times it’s not worth it. Half of them don’t know the difference between a desktop and an app on a phone. You know what if you say you’re going to offer someone some thing or you say you’re going to do something or don’t do it unless you can really do it. Basically stop lying!!!!!!

title: Good but certain annoying things
text: I use it as an article feed. They renamed the ‘feed’ to ‘discover’. ‘Feed’ was a more appropriate name. Also they have started to show articles from months and years ago which doesn’t work for me because I use it as a daily feed. The ‘people also view’ bar at the bottom is really annoying and I never use it. Finally it’s hard to manage multiple tabs in the app. Otherwise a really good app for having a good news feed.

title: Google Won't Let Me Have a Beer
text: It all started when my sister Laura made her awesome chicken tacos and I wanted to have a beer with them, but we had just been to the beach where I stepped on a bee which gave me a totally huge allergic reaction.  So I took two Benadryls. After putting an IPA in the freezer (hoppiness is happiness) to chill to have with my tacos, I thought to myself, "Self, you should find out if it's ok to have alcohol with Benadryl."  So I googled it, and Google straight up, no apologies, no consideration for my feelings, told me I can't have my beer. Bad google. Such condensation. I will now give a bad review to Benadryl, La Jolla Shores, and to bees. You may have told me the truth, Google, but not the truth that would make me and my tacos happy. Stupid google.

title: Ummm is it safari or google
text: OK so on my phone I have Google are use it all the time and then I go off my phone I don’t have Google the next time I go back on what I do you have a Safari it works exactly like Google I want to go onto Safari it says it is going well I’m not even on the website google it just says I’m on Google and it’s a little bit weird that Google decided to change this picture to Safari’s picture but then it also says the app is called Safari where do you google and it’s still let me update Google and it also lets me update Safari when I never had safari it’s so annoying

title: Great App
text:
I’ve used Google almost every day for a couple years now, and I don’t think I’ve come across any bugs. I love the news function that comes with your Google account and I use the keyboard it comes with. The only issue is that occasionally I get a pop-up with an ad that's 100% a scam, and you can only get rid of it by restarting the app. I don't think that's the kind of thing Google can though.

Totally recommend!
